meanings.definition: To pass a rope through (a ring or other opening).
meanings.sent1: The sailor carefully reeves the rope through the pulley.
meanings.sent2: She reeves the thread through the needle to sew the button.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten reeves the yarn through the chair legs, creating a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: Like a skilled weaver, she reeves the colorful threads through the loom, creating a beautiful tapestry.
meanings.sent5: He reeves the fishing line through the eye of the hook, ready to catch a big fish.

meanings.definition: A local official or chief magistrate in some English towns.
meanings.sent1: The reeves of the small town were respected by all the villagers.
meanings.sent2: The reeves gathered to discuss important matters affecting the community.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children playfully elected their cat as the honorary reeves of the backyard.
meanings.sent4: She ruled the classroom with authority, like a wise reeves of an ancient village.
meanings.sent5: The reeves wore traditional robes and carried a staff, symbolizing their leadership role in the town.
